issues.description: The template's ArrayHelpers defines a method named appendElement(...), but other template code (Stock.addToStockIngredients) calls ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). This name/signature mismatch will cause compilation errors in the provided template and block students from building/running the project. The solution repository uses the name addElementToArray, showing the intended API. This is an unintentional structural inconsistency (method signature/name mismatch) between template files and the reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the ArrayHelpers API consistent across the template. Either rename the method in the template ArrayHelpers from appendElement(...) to addElementToArray(...), or update Stock.addToStockIngredients to call appendElement(...). Aligning the method name with the solution (addElementToArray) is recommended so template and solution use the same helper API and students can compile and run the project.

issues.description: The ArrayHelpers helper method is named appendElement(...) in the template, but other code (Stock.addToStockIngredients) in the template and the solution implementation expect addElementToArray(...). This inconsistent identifier naming for the same helper operation will cause compilation problems and confuse students who are instructed to use ArrayHelpers (problem tip) — they will see a helper method with a different name than the calls in the code and in the reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper method name consistent across artifacts. Rename the template ArrayHelpers.appendElement(...) method to addElementToArray(...) (matching the calls in Stock and the reference solution), or alternatively change Stock.addToStockIngredients to call appendElement(...). Prefer aligning to addElementToArray(...) to match the solution and eliminate student confusion.
